00041 #ifndef __LVFS_H__
00042 #define __LVFS_H__
00043 
00044 #include <linux/dcache.h>
00045 #include <linux/err.h>
00046 #include <linux/fs.h>
00047 #include <linux/mutex.h>
00048 #include <linux/namei.h>
00049 #include <lustre_compat.h>
00050 
00051 #define OBD_RUN_CTXT_MAGIC      0xC0FFEEAA
00052 #define OBD_CTXT_DEBUG          /* development-only debugging */
00053 
00054 struct dt_device;
00055 
00056 struct lvfs_run_ctxt {
00057         struct vfsmount         *pwdmnt;
00058         struct dentry           *pwd;
00059         mm_segment_t             fs;
00060         int                      umask;
00061         struct dt_device        *dt;
00062 #ifdef OBD_CTXT_DEBUG
00063         unsigned int             magic;
00064 #endif
00065 };
00066 
00067 static inline void OBD_SET_CTXT_MAGIC(struct lvfs_run_ctxt *ctxt)
00068 {
00069 #ifdef OBD_CTXT_DEBUG
00070         ctxt->magic = OBD_RUN_CTXT_MAGIC;
00071 #endif
00072 }
00073 
00074 /* ptlrpc_sec_ctx.c */
00075 void push_ctxt(struct lvfs_run_ctxt *save, struct lvfs_run_ctxt *new_ctx);
00076 void pop_ctxt(struct lvfs_run_ctxt *saved, struct lvfs_run_ctxt *new_ctx);
00077 
00078 /* We need to hold the inode semaphore over the dcache lookup itself, or we
00079  * run the risk of entering the filesystem lookup path concurrently on SMP
00080  * systems, and instantiating two inodes for the same entry.  We still
00081  * protect against concurrent addition/removal races with the DLM locking.
00082  */
00083 static inline struct dentry *
00084 ll_lookup_one_len(const char *fid_name, struct dentry *dparent,
00085                   int fid_namelen)
00086 {
00087         struct dentry *dchild;
00088 
00089         mutex_lock(&dparent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00090         dchild = lookup_one_len(fid_name, dparent, fid_namelen);
00091         mutex_unlock(&dparent->d_inode->i_mutex);
00092 
00093         if (IS_ERR(dchild) || dchild->d_inode == NULL)
00094                 return dchild;
00095 
00096         if (is_bad_inode(dchild->d_inode)) {
00097                 CERROR("bad inode returned %lu/%u\n",
00098                        dchild->d_inode->i_ino, dchild->d_inode->i_generation);
00099                 dput(dchild);
00100                 dchild = ERR_PTR(-ENOENT);
00101         }
00102 
00103         return dchild;
00104 }
00105 
00106 #endif
